Butter 
75 gram cocoa 
Granulated sugar
Espresso
Sift out 
Whisk
3 eggs
1 t spoon vanilla
1 t salt
1 and half cup chocolate
120 gram flour

‚Ä¢ 1 cup (226g) butter
‚Ä¢ 3/4 cup (75g) unsweetened cocoa powder 
‚Ä¢ 2 cups (400g) granulated sugar 
‚Ä¢ 1 tsp instant expresso powder (optional)
‚Ä¢ 3 large eggs (room temp)
‚Ä¢ 1 tbsp (15ml) vanilla
‚Ä¢ 1 tsp salt
‚Ä¢ 1 1/2 cups (270g) semisweet chocolate chips 
‚Ä¢ 1 cup (120g) all purpose flour

1. melt all the butter in the microwave. 
2. sift cocoa powder and sugar into the butter and mix until well combined. 
3. add in the expresso powder (optional) and 3 eggs, salt, vanilla into your mixture. 
you can use a hand mixer or a stand mixer for this step. 
4. cut up your chocolate into pieces and add them into your mixture, after that add in flour. 
5. fold gently until the flour disappears from the mixture and it‚Äôs ready! 
6. pour the batter into a pan lined with parchment paper.
7. this goes into the pre-heated oven (350 degrees) and bake for 35-40 minutes depending on how you want the brownies to come out!

(350 degree FAHRENHEIT and 180 degree CELSIUS)*

this is really a smart video. for anyone who's curious, there are alternatives to chocolate out there and one of them is carob. carob is basically, diet chocolate, it doesn't have any of the texture chocolate does and will make anything it's added to taste bad, because it's basically edible chalk, in that it's naturally salty and has no value as a nutritional item. also it's naturally oily and will cause problems if not handled properly. unless you are allergic to chocolate, avoid carob.

Oven to 350

Cube 1 cup or 226 g of butter
Melt butter and stir in between 
Add 3/4 cup or 75g of cocoa powder 
2 cups or 400g granulated sugar
1tsp of instant expresso powder (optional) 
Sift
Whisk vigorously for crackly top
3 large room temp eggs
1tbsp of vanilla
1tsp salt
Whisk again
Make sure it‚Äôs not that grainy
Chocolate bar, 270 g or 1 and 1/2 cup
120 g or leveled 1 cup all purpose flour 
Mix until flour is just incorporated 
Transfer batter into pan 
Bake for 35-40ish mins for fudgy or cakes brownie

Can you use olive oil instead of butter?

Update: you can if you use warm oil, and if you add another cup of flour, up to a half cup of milk, and use aluminum foil in a bread pan.  They're still a little fudgy but they're also really soft soft and almost like air they melt in your mouth so fast and you're still left with a full feeling and chocolatey taste.

You can also choose not to add the chocolate chunks. It's really delicious. I made like 5-6 different batches and variations of this recipe.

BUT WHAT EVER YOU DO AT LEAST USE ALUMINUM FOIL!

if you try just using butter or oil to coat the pan, it will cause the outside crust to sort of caramelize and it may end up sticking to the pan.

1 batch didn't stick but was hard to get out, then I got 2 batches that ended up sticking. I also burnt 2 batches because they were thinly laid in the pan and I left them in there the max amount of time.

So this recipe is fun but can be tricky if you have to adjust ingredients or don't have aluminum foil at minimum.
